Description: The sheet "Promoters vs Detractors (2019)" in the workbook "Consolidated Cookbook" compares people metrics for the year 2019. The data is sourced from a single column named "Detractor/Promoter" in the datasource "Sheet1" which is connected to the database "Claim Data.xlsx" using the connection "excel-direct". The sheet contains information about the number of detractors and promoters for a particular product or service.

The sheet "Y-o-Y CSAT Comparison" in the Tableau dashboard "Comparison of People Metrics" compares the customer satisfaction (CSAT) scores of an organization and the industry it operates in over the years. The data is sourced from the Excel file "NPS Metrics.xlsx" and the specific sheet used is "Sheet1". The sheet has three columns - "CSAT (Org)", "CSAT (Industry)", and "Year" - with data for each column stored in separate tables also named "Sheet1". The dashboard is part of the "Consolidated Cookbook" workbook in the "Default" project of the "890Portal" site.

The sheet "Cycle Times on Insurance Claim" in the "Consolidated Cookbook" workbook compares people metrics related to cycle times on insurance claims. The data is sourced from the "Claim Data" Excel file, specifically from Sheet1. The sheet contains two columns - CYCLE TIME and ID - and the table name is also Sheet1. The dashboard is located in the Default project on the 890Portal site.

The sheet "Rural/Urban Distribution (2019)" in the "Consolidated Cookbook" workbook compares people metrics based on urbanicity. The data is sourced from the "Sheet1" datasource, which is connected to the "Claim Data.xlsx" database using the "excel-direct" connection. The sheet has only one column named "URBANICITY" and is part of the "Sheet1" table. Further details about the data and the metrics being compared are not provided in the metadata.

The sheet named "Y-o-Y NPS Comparison" in the Tableau dashboard "Comparison of People Metrics" compares the Net Promoter Score (NPS) of an organization with the NPS of the industry for different years. The data is sourced from an Excel file named "NPS Metrics.xlsx" and the connection to the database is established through the "excel-direct" connection. The sheet contains three columns - Year, NPS (Org), and NPS (Industry) - and the table name for all three columns is "Sheet1".
